comments:
Version: 3.3.0
Build id: I20061003-0800

When I closed a wizard on Vista I got the following exception to to an OLE element disabling. The problem is I am not sure what OLE client site I had open - I was only using Java editors and PDE editors.

I tried to replicate with one of our OLE editors opened but could not. Is there some other OLE element I could have activated?

No idea how this could be possible unless IOleInPlaceObject.InPlaceDeactivate() runs an event loop or calls UpdateWindow() in the operating system C code.

I can consistently get this using the extension point wizard from the PDE plugins pages as well.

The OLE control is probably the browser.  I think that on Vista, OLE deactivate is either running and event loop or forcing a paint to happen.  This causes a label to draw using an image that has been disposed.

Do we know which image is getting disposed?
No but I am pretty sure I can replicate self hosted if required.

Seems like OLE has changed on Vista to call UpdateWindow() way down deep in the OLE C code when the client site is deactivated, forcing a label to draw with an image that has been disposed.
Tod, can you find me and make this happen on my machine?
I just opened https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=186843. Is it similar ?

Shilpa this is not the same thing.

Steve I cannot replicate with M7 on Vista Ultimate. I think this can be closed as WORKSFORME.
Closing for now.  I'll look into the other bug.
